content: reimbursed by your employer) and keep a record of the expense, such as a receipt or an invoice. ## What deductions can I claim? There is a wide range of deductions you can claim as a cleaner, such as: - Car expenses if you must transport heavy or bulky equipment to your workplace (like a portable vacuum cleaner) and have no secure place to store them at your workplace. - Car and other transport expenses if you must drive between jobs during your workday (e.g., if you clean properties in multiple locations on the same day). - The cost of purchasing, repairing, and cleaning any distinctive work-related clothing (such as a logo T-shirt or branded overalls). - The cost of buying any protective items for personal use during your work, such as a vacuum cleaner or mop. - Phone and internet expenses for your own phone or device if you need to use it for work purposes (e.g., to schedule or manage appointments), and your employer does not provide a phone or reimburse expenses (keep records for claims over $50). - Self-education expenses for attending courses, training, or seminars specifically related to your current job (e.g., a course on advanced
